ygData.subject: Re: Tailoring
ygData.msgSnippet: Thanks for the info. I will run by Highpass and purchase a bit of ore to try out. See just how hard hunting my own will be. I might be wise to postpone the
ygData.messageBody:
Thanks for the info. I will run by Highpass and purchase a bit of ore
to try out. See just how hard hunting my own will be. I might be wise
to postpone the visit to Kunark for a few more levels, from what I
have read here. I am sure I can find something useful to do for a few
levels. Any suggestions for possible good zones in Kunark to work
through those levels? Might be good to do my leveling there after
all. Once I have a Kunark bind point I can move back and forth
quickly enough.

Barto Proudfoot

--- In EverQuest@y..., "Su" <suceress@k...> wrote:
>
> > Any higher level tailors out there? I am lvl 70 in tailoring, and
> > working toward making Halfling tailored and imbued armor. I am a
> > level 29 halfling druid, able so far to brew and smith the various
> > parts I have needed to make my reinforced leather armor. I am
soon to
> > be off to Kunark to obtain my brute hides. Anyone been a brute
> > hunter, who can give me any advice?
>
> High quality ore drops off of pickclaw warriors and raiders in
> Highpass/Highkeep (I can never keep it straight which is called
which). You
> would need a group at your level. Since you are a druid, people
would really
> want you in group there. Sow can be cast. And if you have regen and
other
> beneficial spells they will love you. Especially since you can
heal. If you
> have coin to spend, go to highkeep and auction to buy high quality
ore.
> There are usually some players who will part with it. I think the
small
> bricks go for around 5pp and the large bricks around 10pp.
> You too!
> luv,
> -Su
